commands.name: Reset Task Manager
commands.description: Reset Task Manager to default Windows installation state
commands.notes: This will reset all Task Manager settings including column layouts, window size, and view preferences. Task Manager must be restarted after running this command.

commands.name: Reset File Explorer
commands.description: Reset File Explorer to default Windows settings
commands.command: taskkill /F /IM explorer.exe && reg delete "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer" /f && reg delete "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Shell\BagMRU" /f && reg delete "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Shell\Bags" /f && reg delete "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\ShellNoRoam\Bags" /f && reg delete "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\ShellNoRoam\BagMRU" /f && reg delete "HKCU\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Shell\BagMRU" /f && reg delete "HKCU\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Shell\Bags" /f && start explorer.exe
commands.notes: This will reset File Explorer settings including view preferences, folder positions, and navigation pane settings. File Explorer will be restarted automatically.

commands.name: Clear DNS Cache
commands.notes: Useful when experiencing website loading issues or after changing DNS settings.

commands.name: Reset Network Stack
commands.command: netsh winsock reset && netsh int ip reset && ipconfig /release && ipconfig /renew && ipconfig /flushdns
commands.notes: This will reset all network adapters and settings. Your internet connection will be temporarily disrupted during this process.

commands.name: System File Check
commands.description: Scan and repair Windows system files
commands.notes: This scan may take several minutes to complete. The system will attempt to repair any corrupted system files it finds.

commands.name: Check Disk
commands.description: Check disk for errors and attempt repairs
commands.notes: This will schedule a disk check on next system restart. The process may take several minutes to complete depending on disk size.

commands.name: Clear Temp Files
commands.notes: This will remove temporary files to free up disk space. Some files may be in use and cannot be deleted.

commands.name: Reset Print Spooler
commands.description: Reset the Windows Print Spooler service
commands.command: net stop spooler && del /F /S /Q %systemroot%\System32\spool\PRINTERS\* && net start spooler
commands.notes: This will clear the print queue and restart the print spooler service. Use this when experiencing printing issues.
